intro: Bufonia elata, commonly known as the tall false dandelion, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow composite flowers. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Bufonia elata is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous small seeds, facilitating its dispersal by wind.
